sections.name: Multiple-choice questions
sections.instructions:
Answer all questions in pencil on the answer sheet provided for multiple-choice questions.
Choose the response that is correct or that best answers the question.
A correct answer scores 1; an incorrect answer scores 0.
Marks will not be deducted for incorrect answers.
No marks will be given if more than one answer is completed for any question.

content.text: The most appropriate data type to store a value that reflects the length of a window frame in millimetres is
Which one of the following is a suitable technique for documenting the need or opportunity for a school canteen stock tracking software?
Which search algorithm would be the best choice if the canteen staff want the fastest option to search a product list by name?

choices: Quick search, if the list is sorted
Linear search, if the list is unsorted
Binary search, if the list is unsorted
Selection search, if the list is sorted

content.text: Which set of test data should be used to check a validation rule that limits all item prices to values between 50 cents and $8.00?
Assuming that time is not a constraint, which is the most appropriate technique to collect detailed and authentic data about an existing information system?
Having a limited amount of time to complete a software solution is an example of
Consider the following partial use case diagram, which shows how a gym member interacts with a booking system for personal trainers.
<<__>>, next to each dashed arrow indicates which relationship type?
After an SRS has been completed, designs need to be created. Which of the following are valid techniques for generating different design ideas?

Richard is designing a software solution that requires users to interact with the solution using a variety of devices and operating systems. What are the most important design factors Richard should consider?
An organisation disposed of files in January 2019. In November 2020, those files

choices: Can be recovered from desktop trash
Can be recovered from backups stored offsite

content.text: To upload an Australian landscape photograph using a wireless connection at 20 megabits per second with an average file size of 5 megabytes will take approximately
Which one of the following is the name of the data structure that stores member information, including name, gender, age group, and best time?
What is the output of the following pseudocode?
A = 7, B = 1, C = A * B, A = A - 1, B = B + 1. Repeat until A < 4. Print C.
The validation that checks if a number entered is positive is called
When developing a software solution, the data used for testing validation would include
Which precaution could Remi have taken to prevent malware from accessing his data after installing third-party applications?
A suitable criterion for evaluating the efficiency of a software solution is

choices: The final output has all required components
The solution requires fewer steps to complete tasks

content.text: Version control is used in software development to

choices: Help developers keep track of the correct version
Ensure multiple versions are presented to clients
Fully test solutions to meet functional requirements

content.text: Cross-site scripting occurs when a

choices: Web browser becomes infected with malware
Web application delivers malicious script to the user's browser
Web server returns internal server errors

sections.name: Short-answer questions
sections.instructions: Answer all questions in the spaces provided.

content.text: Explain the purpose of a naming convention and how it will assist with improving a data dictionary.

content.answer: A naming convention provides consistency in naming variables, making it easier to read and maintain code.

content.text: Complete the pseudocode for the 'Guess the secret number' game.

content.answer:
secretNum = random(1,100)
guessCounter = 0
Print "Enter the secret number"
guessNum = input value
Repeat until guessNum = secretNum or guessCounter >= 15
 If guessNum > secretNum
 Print "Too high"
 guessCounter += 1
 Else If guessNum < secretNum
 Print "Too low"
 guessCounter += 1
 End If
Print guessCounter
If guessCounter < 15
 Print "Well done!"
Else
 Print "It took too long!"

content.text: Explain why a function would be used to perform a calculation instead of a procedure.

content.answer: A function is used to perform a calculation because it returns a value, whereas a procedure does not.

content.text: List two procedures for managing data and files used in a software solution.

content.answer:
1. Regular backups
2. Archiving and disposal of data

sections.name: Case study
sections.instructions: Use the case study provided in the insert to answer the questions in this section. Answers must apply to the case study.

content.text: Identify one information system goal of the FRIDGESMART app.

content.answer: To provide efficient ordering of HOMEMADE products.

content.text: Justify why John selected an agile development model rather than a waterfall development model for the app.

content.answer: Agile allows for feedback and adaptability at the end of each iteration, whereas waterfall does not allow for changes once development starts.

content.text: Complete the data flow diagram by writing the correct labels for A, B, C, and D.

content.answer:
A = Customer
B = Order confirmation notification
C = Customer order
D = HOMEMADE database
